ON.name: Ontario

eligibility.notes: No minimum employment period, but must work last scheduled shift before and first scheduled shift after the holiday. ESA s.24: All employees working on public holiday receive 1.5x premium pay regardless of eligibility status.

ON.notes: Ontario ESA s.24 - (total wages in 4 weeks + vacation pay) / 20

BC.name: British Columbia

eligibility.notes: 30 calendar days of employment required. Must have worked or earned wages on 15 of 30 days before the holiday. Ineligible employees working on holiday receive regular wages only.

BC.notes: BC ESA s.45 - wages in 30 days / days worked. Wages include regular wages, statutory holiday pay, annual vacation pay, and sick pay. Premium: 1.5x up to 12 hours, 2x over 12 hours.

AB.name: Alberta

eligibility.notes: 30 WORK days (not calendar days) in 12 months prior. Must work last shift before and first shift after holiday. Uses '5 of 9' rule. ESC s.25: Employees working on holiday receive 1.5x regardless of eligibility.

AB.notes: Alberta ESC s.25 - wages in 4 weeks / days worked. Construction: 3.6%. Incentive pay employees: 4.2% of wages in 4 weeks.

QC.name: Quebec

eligibility.notes: No minimum employment period. Must not be absent without valid reason on day before or after holiday. Labour Standards Act: Working on holiday = 1.5x premium + compensation.

QC.notes: Quebec Labour Standards Act (CNESST) - 1/20 of wages in 4 weeks before holiday week. Vacation pay must be included per CNESST rules. Commission employees: 1/60 of wages in 12 weeks (pending implementation, requires employee type identifier support).

MB.name: Manitoba

eligibility.notes: No minimum employment period. Must not be absent without permission on last scheduled day before or first scheduled day after holiday. ESC: All employees working on general holiday receive 1.5x premium.

MB.notes: Manitoba Employment Standards Code - 5% of gross wages in 4-week period. Construction industry: 4%.

SK.name: Saskatchewan

eligibility.notes: No minimum employment period required. Employment Act: All employees working on public holiday receive 1.5x premium.

SK.notes: Saskatchewan Employment Act - 5% of wages in preceding 28 days. Official calculator available.

NB.name: New Brunswick

eligibility.notes: 90 days of employment in 12 months prior. Must work scheduled day before and after holiday. ESA: All employees entitled to 1.5x for hours worked on public holiday.

NB.notes: New Brunswick Employment Standards Act - regular day's wage (30-day average). NB hourly employees use Daily Average; does not implement 4% alternative method (employer-choice option, requires separate configuration).

NS.name: Nova Scotia

eligibility.notes: Must be entitled to pay for at least 15 of 30 days before holiday. Must work last scheduled shift before and first scheduled shift after holiday. LSC: Ineligible employees may be paid as regular workday.

NS.notes: Nova Scotia Labour Standards Code - wages in 30 days / days worked. Per NS LSC s.2, 'wages' explicitly excludes vacation pay. Previous holiday pay IS included per NS practice. Remembrance Day covered by separate Remembrance Day Act.

PE.name: Prince Edward Island

eligibility.notes: 30 days employment required, must earn wages on 15 of 30 days, must work last shift before and first shift after holiday. ESA: BC-style eligibility requirements - ineligible employees receive regular wages.

PE.notes: PEI Employment Standards Act - 15 days worked rule unique to PEI

NL.name: Newfoundland and Labrador

eligibility.notes: 30 days of employment required. Must work last scheduled shift before AND first scheduled shift after holiday. LSA s.17: Ineligible employees may be paid as regular workday.

NL.notes: NL Labour Standards Act - hourly rate Ã— (hours in 3 weeks / 15). Working on holiday: double regular wages OR extra day off.

NT.name: Northwest Territories

eligibility.notes: 30 days employment within 12 months prior. Must work scheduled day before AND first shift after holiday. ESA: Ineligible employees receive regular wages only.

NT.notes: NWT Employment Standards Act - Hourly employees: normal work day's wage (daily rate). Salaried employees: average day's pay from 4-week period. Overtime threshold reduced to 32 hours in holiday week.

eligibility.notes: 30 days employment within 12 months prior. Must work last scheduled shift before AND first shift after holiday. LSA: Ineligible employees receive regular wages only.

YT.name: Yukon

eligibility.notes: 30 calendar days employment required. Must work last scheduled shift before AND first scheduled shift after holiday (unless permitted absence). ESA: Premium pay (1.5x) applies even if employed less than 30 days.

YT.notes: Yukon ESA - Regular employees: regular day's pay (30-day average). Casual/irregular hours employees: 10% of wages (including overtime) in 2 weeks prior. Uses yt_split_by_employment formula type to route based on employment_type field.

Federal.name: Federal

eligibility.notes: No minimum employment period. All federally regulated employees qualify for general holidays. CLC s.197: Premium pay (1.5x) only for employees entitled to holiday pay.

Federal.notes: Canada Labour Code Part III s.196 - 1/20th of wages in 4 weeks before holiday week. Per CLC s.186: 'Vacation pay shall for all purposes be deemed to be wages', so vacation pay IS included. Only overtime is explicitly excluded per s.196. Commission employees: 1/60 of wages in 12 weeks (pending implementation, requires employee type identifier support).
